sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Analysts warn that a record year-end options expiry is now the dominant volatility driver, as bitcoin traded under $90000 while gold surged.
The Bank of Japan raised interest rates to 0.75% on December 19, marking the highest borrowing costs in three decades and triggering...

Global markets were hit with a violent liquidity whiplash today as conflicting central bank signals collided with a massive derivatives...

hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Convergence Volatility Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: Concurrent catalysts (options expiry + BOJ + COIN news) occurring within 72 hours will create volatility regime shift, where 4-hour Bollinger Band width expands by >40% from compressed levels (<0.8x 20-day average), with the expansion direction favoring break of nearest major liquidity level (weekly high/low within 2%).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Multiple structural catalysts converging increase probability of regime change. Volatility compression during event clustering represents uncertainty premium. Break toward nearest liquidity pool suggests market choosing path of least resistance.
entry_conditions: BTC 4-hour BB width <0.8x 20-day average during catalyst window
Price tests within 2% of weekly high or low with increasing volume profile

exit_conditions.take_profit: BB width expansion ≥60% from entry with directional move ≥3%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BB width remains compressed (<20% expansion) for 24 hours post-catalyst

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Multiple catalysts occur but volatility remains compressed (BB width expansion <20%), indicating market indifference or offsetting effects.
